alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Hardin (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 03 at 10:15PM CST until March 10 at 8:20PM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Tennessee... Tennessee River at Savannah affecting Decatur and Hardin Counties. For the Tennessee River...including Savannah...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tennessee River at Savannah. * WHEN...Until Friday evening. * IMPACTS...At 371.0 feet, Federal Road is flooded at Lick Creek north of Hamburg. Parts of Lacefield Drive are covered by flood water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 PM CST Friday the stage was 367.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Sunday morning to a crest of 371.1 feet Tuesday evening. It will then fall below flood stage Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 370.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 370.7 feet on 03/11/1967. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning at 1015 AM CST.
